{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-124-15-A |Item_parent=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330) |Item_parent_short=Menopause, premature ovarian failure, andropause, age-related androgen deficiency (See item 330) |Rank=A |Title=Know the definition of andropause or age-related androgen deficiency. |Description=None |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=Benjamin Pradere |Order=15}}
*The term ''age-related testosterone deficiency syndrome'' should be preferred to the term ''andropause''. *Its definition is based on the ''association'' of a ''biochemical syndrome'' (hypotestosteronemia) with a ''decrease in serum androgens'' associated with ''advancing age'' impacting on ''quality of life'' and the function of certain organs (Figure 1).
[File:Figure1definition.png|neant|vignette|alt=|Figure1]]
The biochemical deficit is defined by a test of testosterone '''total and bioavailable''' in the morning (8-11H)

question.title: What is the definition of age-related androgen deficiency?
question.description: The term associated with a biochemical syndrome and a decrease in serum androgens linked to advancing age.

option_a.title: A decrease in serum androgens associated with advancing age impacting on quality of life and the function of certain organs.
option_a.description: The biochemical deficit is defined by a test of testosterone total and bioavailable in the morning (8-11H)

option_b.title: The term andropause should be preferred to age-related testosterone deficiency syndrome.
option_b.description: Its definition is based on the association of a biochemical syndrome (hypotestosteronemia) with a decrease in serum androgens associated with advancing age impacting on quality of life and the function of certain organs (Figure 1).

option_c.title: The biochemical deficit is defined by a test of testosterone total and bioavailable in the morning (8-11H).
option_c.description: The term age-related testosterone deficiency syndrome should be preferred to the term andropause.

option_d.title: A decrease in serum androgens associated with advancing age impacting on quality of life and the function of certain organs.
option_d.description: The biochemical deficit is defined by a test of testosterone total and bioavailable in the morning (8-11H)
